title: Quiz 3: Management - Unconscious & Burns
description: Care protocols for unconscious patients and burn victims, including fluid calculation formulas.

questions.question: Calculate the total fluid requirement for the first 24 hours for a 60kg patient with 30% burns using the Parkland Formula.
Using Wallace's Rule of Nines, match the body area to its percentage:
questions.explanation: Head (9%), Arms (9% each), Front Trunk (18%), Back Trunk (18%), Legs (18% each), Perineum (1%).
questions.hint: The trunk is double the size of an arm.

questions.question: Which of the following are priorities in the management of an unconscious patient? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Unconscious patients need airway care, turning for skin integrity, and eye care. Oral feeding is dangerous due to aspiration risk; NG tube is used.

questions.question: A ___BLANK___ burn involves destruction of the dermis and requires skin grafting.
questions.explanation: Full thickness burns destroy the dermis and will not heal without grafting.

questions.question: Order the immediate actions for a patient with chemical burns:

items.text: Wash off chemical with cold water

questions.explanation: Airway is always first (ABC). Then remove the cause (wash), expose the area (clothing), and protect (cover).
questions.hint: ABC comes before treating the wound.

questions.question: Prophylactic antibiotics are highly recommended and provide a significant advantage in all burns cases.
questions.explanation: Studies indicate that prophylactic antibiotics provide no advantage in burns care. Antibiotics are used when specific infection is identified.
questions.hint: Does prevention work better than treating specific infections in burns?

questions.question: What is the main early cause of death in patients with major burns?
questions.explanation: Fluid loss leads to hypovolemic shock, which is the main early killer.
questions.hint: What leaks out of the damaged capillaries?

questions.question: Which position is best for maintaining the airway in an unconscious patient?
questions.explanation: The recovery position facilitates drainage of secretions from the oral cavity.
questions.hint: It prevents the tongue from falling back.

questions.question: Which of the following indicate a severe burn requiring transfer to a Regional Centre? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Small partial thickness burn on leg

questions.explanation: Major burns (>30%), burns to special areas (face, hands), and electrical burns require specialized care.
questions.hint: Think about complex areas and large surface areas.

questions.question: When calculating IV flow rate: (Total Volume x Drop Factor) divided by ___BLANK___ gives drops per minute.
questions.explanation: Formula: (Volume x Drops/ml) / Time in minutes = Drops/min.
